docs.text: public interface UserManager ¶ Main class responsible for user sessions, registration and login. Class Methods ¶ addListener(UserManager.Listener listener) ¶ void addListener ( UserManager . Listener listener ) Adds listener to receive callbacks Parameters: listener - the listener getCurrentUserSession() ¶ UserSession getCurrentUserSession () Returns current user session (if any) Returns: active user session or null if there is no active user session UserSession logout(UserManagerCallback callback) ¶ void logout ( UserManagerCallback callback ) Logs out current user Resets session accordingly Returns server response via callback Parameters: callback - the callback registerDevice(UserManagerCallback callback) ¶ void registerDevice ( UserManagerCallback callback ) Registers device with Pointr Cloud Returns server response via callback Parameters: callback - the callback UserManagerCallback removeListener(UserManager.Listener listener) ¶ void removeListener ( UserManager . Listener listener ) Removes listener to stop receiving callbacks Parameters: listener - the listener setPreferredLanguage(String languageCode, boolean shouldUpdateLocalResourceLanguageAlso) ¶ void setPreferredLanguage ( String languageCode , boolean shouldUpdateLocalResourceLanguageAlso ) Sets preferred language for current user. This allows content to have relevant translation if available. If not, content is returned in default language. SDK will remember user’s preferred language until it’s set to another language or reset. Parameters: languageCode - ISO language code with or without locale are supported (eg. “en”, “jp”, “en_US”“, “en_UK”). Passing in nil will reset user preference to default. shouldUpdateLocalResourceLanguageAlso - If true, will update local system resources language also. If not, will only update Pointr Cloud content preferred language.
docs.title: UserManager

docs.text: public static interface DataManager.Listener ¶ Class Methods ¶ onDataManagerBeginProcessingDataForVenue(Venue venue, Facility facility, DataType dataType, boolean isOnlineData) ¶ void onDataManagerBeginProcessingDataForVenue ( Venue venue , Facility facility , DataType dataType , boolean isOnlineData ) This callback is triggered when data management begins processing given data for the given venue Parameters: venue - The venue the data management started in facility - The facility the data management started in dataType - The data type data management started for isOnlineData - Indicates if the started data management is online or offline onDataManagerBeginProcessingGlobalData(DataType type, boolean isOnlineData) ¶ void onDataManagerBeginProcessingGlobalData ( DataType type , boolean isOnlineData ) Notifies listeners when data manager starts to process specified global data, either from server (online) or local data (offline) Parameters: type - Type of global data isOnlineData - true if data is downloaded from server (online), false if local data (offline) onDataManagerBeginProcessingMapUpdateForVenue(Venue venue, Facility facility, int level, DataType type, boolean isOnlineData) ¶ void onDataManagerBeginProcessingMapUpdateForVenue ( Venue venue , Facility facility , int level , DataType type , boolean isOnlineData ) This callback is triggered when data management for map level is started for the given venue Parameters: venue - The venue the map data update has started for facility - The facility the map data update has started for level - The level that the map data update has started for type - The type of map update that has started. Raster or Tiled isOnlineData - Indicates if the data update was of online or offline data onDataManagerCompleteAllForVenue(Venue venue, Facility facility, boolean isSuccessful, boolean isOnlineData, List errors) ¶ void onDataManagerCompleteAllForVenue ( Venue venue , Facility facility , boolean isSuccessful , boolean isOnlineData , List < ErrorMessage > errors ) This callback is triggered when data management for all data types in the given venue is completed Parameters: venue - The venue the data management for all the data types is completed. facility - This is always null, does not specify anything significant isSuccessful - Specifies if the data management was successfull isOnlineData - Specifies if the completed data management was online or offline data errors - Returns the error list if any error has been faced onDataManagerEndProcessingDataForVenue(Venue venue, Facility facility, DataType dataType, boolean isOnlineData, boolean isSuccessful, List errors) ¶ void onDataManagerEndProcessingDataForVenue ( Venue venue , Facility facility , DataType dataType , boolean isOnlineData , boolean isSuccessful , List < ErrorMessage > errors ) This callback is triggered when data management for the given data for the given venue is finished Parameters: venue - The venue the data management is finished for facility - The facility the data management is finished for dataType - The data type the data management is finished for isOnlineData - Indicates if the data management finished is online or offline isSuccessful - Indicates if the data management was successful or not errors - If the data management was not successful, this includes the list of errors encountered onDataManagerEndProcessingGlobalData(DataType type, boolean isOnlineData, boolean isSuccessful) ¶ void onDataManagerEndProcessingGlobalData ( DataType type , boolean isOnlineData , boolean isSuccessful ) Notifies listeners when data manager starts to process specified global data, either from server (online) or local data (offline) Parameters: type - Type of global data isOnlineData - true if data is downloaded from server (online), false if local data (offline) isSuccessful - true if data download is successful, false otherwise onDataManagerEndProcessingMapUpdateForVenue(Venue venue, Facility facility, int level, DataType type, boolean isOnlineData, boolean isSuccessful, List errors) ¶ void onDataManagerEndProcessingMapUpdateForVenue ( Venue venue , Facility facility , int level , DataType type , boolean isOnlineData , boolean isSuccessful , List < ErrorMessage > errors ) This callback is triggered when data management for map level is finished for the given venue Parameters: venue - The venue the map data update has finished facility - The facility the map data update has finished level - The level of the map that the data update has finished type - The type of map update that has ended. Raster or Tiled isOnlineData - Indicates if the data update was of online or offline data isSuccessful - Indicates if the data update was successful or not errors - If the data management was unsuccessful, the list of errors encountered will be listed here onDataManagerStartDataManagementForVenue(Venue venue, Facility facility, boolean isOnlineData) ¶ void onDataManagerStartDataManagementForVenue ( Venue venue , Facility facility , boolean isOnlineData ) This callback is triggered when data management for the given venue and facility has started Parameters: venue - the venue data management is started for facility - the facility datamanagement is started for isOnlineData - specifies if the data management is online or not onVenueReady(Venue venue) ¶ void onVenueReady ( Venue venue ) This callback is triggered when all the data for the given venue is downloaded and ready to use Parameters: venue - The venue that has all the data and is ready to use

docs.text: void onDataManagerBeginProcessingGlobalData ( DataType type , boolean isOnlineData ) Notifies listeners when data manager starts to process specified global data, either from server (online) or local data (offline) Parameters: type - Type of global data isOnlineData - true if data is downloaded from server (online), false if local data (offline)
docs.title: onDataManagerBeginProcessingGlobalData(DataType type, boolean isOnlineData)

docs.text: void onDataManagerBeginProcessingMapUpdateForVenue ( Venue venue , Facility facility , int level , DataType type , boolean isOnlineData ) This callback is triggered when data management for map level is started for the given venue Parameters: venue - The venue the map data update has started for facility - The facility the map data update has started for level - The level that the map data update has started for type - The type of map update that has started. Raster or Tiled isOnlineData - Indicates if the data update was of online or offline data
docs.title: onDataManagerBeginProcessingMapUpdateForVenue(Venue venue, Facility facility, int level, DataType type, boolean isOnlineData)

docs.text: void onDataManagerCompleteAllForVenue ( Venue venue , Facility facility , boolean isSuccessful , boolean isOnlineData , List < ErrorMessage > errors ) This callback is triggered when data management for all data types in the given venue is completed Parameters: venue - The venue the data management for all the data types is completed. facility - This is always null, does not specify anything significant isSuccessful - Specifies if the data management was successfull isOnlineData - Specifies if the completed data management was online or offline data errors - Returns the error list if any error has been faced
docs.title: onDataManagerCompleteAllForVenue(Venue venue, Facility facility, boolean isSuccessful, boolean isOnlineData, List errors)

docs.text: void onDataManagerEndProcessingDataForVenue ( Venue venue , Facility facility , DataType dataType , boolean isOnlineData , boolean isSuccessful , List < ErrorMessage > errors ) This callback is triggered when data management for the given data for the given venue is finished Parameters: venue - The venue the data management is finished for facility - The facility the data management is finished for dataType - The data type the data management is finished for isOnlineData - Indicates if the data management finished is online or offline isSuccessful - Indicates if the data management was successful or not errors - If the data management was not successful, this includes the list of errors encountered
docs.title: onDataManagerEndProcessingDataForVenue(Venue venue, Facility facility, DataType dataType, boolean isOnlineData, boolean isSuccessful, List errors)

docs.text: void onDataManagerEndProcessingGlobalData ( DataType type , boolean isOnlineData , boolean isSuccessful ) Notifies listeners when data manager starts to process specified global data, either from server (online) or local data (offline) Parameters: type - Type of global data isOnlineData - true if data is downloaded from server (online), false if local data (offline) isSuccessful - true if data download is successful, false otherwise
docs.title: onDataManagerEndProcessingGlobalData(DataType type, boolean isOnlineData, boolean isSuccessful)

docs.text: void onDataManagerEndProcessingMapUpdateForVenue ( Venue venue , Facility facility , int level , DataType type , boolean isOnlineData , boolean isSuccessful , List < ErrorMessage > errors ) This callback is triggered when data management for map level is finished for the given venue Parameters: venue - The venue the map data update has finished facility - The facility the map data update has finished level - The level of the map that the data update has finished type - The type of map update that has ended. Raster or Tiled isOnlineData - Indicates if the data update was of online or offline data isSuccessful - Indicates if the data update was successful or not errors - If the data management was unsuccessful, the list of errors encountered will be listed here
docs.title: onDataManagerEndProcessingMapUpdateForVenue(Venue venue, Facility facility, int level, DataType type, boolean isOnlineData, boolean isSuccessful, List errors)

docs.text: void onDataManagerStartDataManagementForVenue ( Venue venue , Facility facility , boolean isOnlineData ) This callback is triggered when data management for the given venue and facility has started Parameters: venue - the venue data management is started for facility - the facility datamanagement is started for isOnlineData - specifies if the data management is online or not
docs.title: onDataManagerStartDataManagementForVenue(Venue venue, Facility facility, boolean isOnlineData)

docs.text: void onVenueReady ( Venue venue ) This callback is triggered when all the data for the given venue is downloaded and ready to use Parameters: venue - The venue that has all the data and is ready to use
docs.title: onVenueReady(Venue venue)

docs.text: public enum DebugTool extends Enum ¶ This class includes the debugging tools for the SDK. It allows third party to develop easier giving them fake position(joystick), showing where the beacons are configured(beacons), showing where walls are drawn(walls), showing the placement of graph nodes(nodes) and showing position clones(clones). Enumerated Values ¶ Beacons ¶ public static final DebugTool Beacons Clones ¶ public static final DebugTool Clones Joystick ¶ public static final DebugTool Joystick Nodes ¶ public static final DebugTool Nodes Walls ¶ public static final DebugTool Walls Class Methods ¶ valueOf(String name) ¶ public static DebugTool valueOf ( String name ) Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.) Parameters: name - the name of the enum constant to be returned. Returns: the enum constant with the specified name Throws: IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name NullPointerException - if the argument is null values() ¶ public static DebugTool [] values () Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: for ( DebugTool c : DebugTool . values ()) System . out . println ( c ); Returns: an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared
docs.title: DebugTool

docs.text: public class POIViewFilter extends Object ¶ This class filters poi views, so that at broader zoom levels, there is not a cluster of POI’s that cause a uneasy user experience. The Pointr Engine has clash algorithms and selection mechanisms to decide which POI will be shown and which will be hidden. This not only checks for POI images but also takes into account labels of the POI’s. Note The selected POI will always be visible. Class Constructors ¶ POIViewFilter(BasePointrMapView map) ¶ public POIViewFilter ( BasePointrMapView map ) Class Methods ¶ filterPOIViews() ¶ public void filterPOIViews () Checks visibilities of POIs at current zoom level Then, resolves view clashes by changing their visibilities. Use when the map mode is not Rotational Tracking mode filterPOIViews(int rotationDegrees) ¶ public void filterPOIViews ( int rotationDegrees ) Checks visibilities of POIs at current zoom level Then, resolves view clashes by changing their visibilities. Parameters: rotationDegrees - degrees of the clockwise rotation isViewIntersectsBoundaries(android.graphics.Rect viewRect, int degrees) ¶ public boolean isViewIntersectsBoundaries ( android . graphics . Rect viewRect , int degrees ) It checks if the given rect intersects with boundaries of marker layout Parameters: viewRect - rect degrees - rotation degrees Returns: true if there is an intersection setSelectedView(android.view.View view) ¶ public void setSelectedView ( android . view . View view )
docs.title: POIViewFilter

docs.text: public abstract class BasePointrMapView extends TileView implements MapView ¶ BasePointrMapView ¶ This view is responsible to draw pointr map. Handles raster and tile map display operations. Handles Pointr configuration updates. Map Functionality ¶ Provides default map functionality as zooming and POI management. to add POIs see addDrawable(MapDrawable) Facility Management ¶ Facilities (see Facility consist of levels. Provides level change and preview functionality see previewLevel(int) and setCurrentLevel(int) Provides displaying different facility other than the user currently present. To achieve this see setForcedFacility(Facility) POI Management ¶ As basic map functionality, this class is capable of displaying POIs of type MapDrawable To add new POI see addDrawable(MapDrawable) Different view can be provided for every map drawable. To provide the desired View for each MapDrawable , set MapViewProvider see setMapViewProvider(MapViewProvider) Class Constructors ¶ BasePointrMapView(android.content.Context context) ¶ public BasePointrMapView ( android . content . Context context ) Instantiates a new Pointr tile map. Parameters: context - the context BasePointrMapView(android.content.Context context, android.util.AttributeSet attrs) ¶ public BasePointrMapView ( android . content . Context context , android . util . AttributeSet attrs ) Instantiates a new Pointr tile map. Parameters: context - the contextfindMap() attrs - the attrs BasePointrMapView(android.content.Context context, android.util.AttributeSet attrs, int defStyleAttr) ¶ public BasePointrMapView ( android . content . Context context , android . util . AttributeSet attrs , int defStyleAttr ) Instantiates a new Pointr tile map. Parameters: context - the context attrs - the attrs defStyleAttr - the def style attr Class Methods ¶ addDrawable(MapDrawable item) ¶ public void addDrawable ( MapDrawable item ) Adds drawable for desired view to display on map. Could be used to add markers and path Parameters: item - addListener(MapView.Listener listener) ¶ public void addListener ( MapView . Listener listener ) Adds listener to observe map interactions Specified by: addListener in interface Advertiser Parameters: listener - A listener of type MapView.Listener destroy() ¶ public void destroy () Clears map data doubleTapZoom(android.view.MotionEvent event) ¶ public void doubleTapZoom ( android . view . MotionEvent event ) Changes the scale according to given MotionEvent Parameters: event - MotionEvent object that contains detail of double tap event drawableExists(MapDrawable drawable) ¶ public boolean drawableExists ( MapDrawable drawable ) Checks if given drawable present in current drawables see addDrawable(MapDrawable) to add drawables Parameters: drawable - to check if present in drawables Returns: true if given drawable exist, false otherwise getActivity() ¶ public android . app . Activity getActivity () Gets activity. Returns: the activity getCenterX() ¶ public float getCenterX () Gets centerX Returns: centerX getCenterY() ¶ public float getCenterY () Gets centerY Returns: centerY getCurrentFacility() ¶ public Facility getCurrentFacility () Gets current facility, Returns: If setForcedFacility(Facility) is set to a different facility and the Facility provided is valid, returns this facility Otherwise, returns facility fro current configuration from FacilityConfiguration.getInternalIdentifier() getCurrentLevel() ¶ public int getCurrentLevel () Gets level that map is currently displaying Returns: currentLevel getCurrentLocation() ¶ public CalculatedLocation getCurrentLocation () Gets the current location in map Returns: CalculatedLocation show in map getCurrentPath() ¶ public Path getCurrentPath () Gets current path Returns: path getCurrentPosition() ¶ @Deprecated public Position getCurrentPosition () Deprecated. getCurrentZoomLevel() ¶ public ZoomLevel getCurrentZoomLevel () Gets current zoom level Returns: current zoom level getIsFirstMapShown() ¶ public boolean getIsFirstMapShown () Returns: true if map is shown, false otherwise getLastZoomLevel() ¶ public ZoomLevel getLastZoomLevel () Get’s lastZoomLevel Returns: lastZoomLevel getMapModeCoordinator() ¶ public MapModeCoordinator getMapModeCoordinator () Gets mode manager. Returns: the mode manager getMaxZoomScale() ¶ public Float getMaxZoomScale () Gets max zoom scale Returns: maxZoomScale getMinZoomScale() ¶ public Float getMinZoomScale () Gets min zoom scale Returns: minZoomScale getPoiViewFilter() ¶ public POIViewFilter getPoiViewFilter () returns poiViewFilter that handles clashes of drawn POIs Returns: poiViewFilter getPointrZoomUnit() ¶ public float getPointrZoomUnit () It devides the specified zoom scales to 10 equal units Returns: quantity of 1 unit getPositionLevel() ¶ @Deprecated public Integer getPositionLevel () Deprecated. Do not use this method. Use getCurrentLocation.getLevel() instead getScaleForFill() ¶ public float getScaleForFill () Computes scale for filling Returns: scale for fill getScalingMarkerLayout() ¶ public MarkerLayout getScalingMarkerLayout () Gets scaling marker layout. Returns: the scaling marker layout getVisibleViewForDrawable(MapDrawable drawable) ¶ public android . view . View getVisibleViewForDrawable ( MapDrawable drawable ) Returns view for given drawable if visible Parameters: drawable - to get view Returns: view for given drawable if visible hasPath() ¶ public boolean hasPath () Returns: true if there is a Path with valid nodes present, false otherwise isPointVisibleInMap(Position position) ¶ public boolean isPointVisibleInMap ( Position position ) Checks whether the given position’s x and y coordinates are on the map visible to the user. onDetailLevelChanged(DetailLevel detailLevel) ¶ public void onDetailLevelChanged ( DetailLevel detailLevel ) onDoubleTap(android.view.MotionEvent event) ¶ public boolean onDoubleTap ( android . view . MotionEvent event ) Notified on map double tapped Parameters: event - MotionEvent of double tap event Returns: true if event is consumed, false otherwise onMapModeChange(MapMode mode) ¶ public void onMapModeChange ( MapMode mode ) Updates map on current MapMode Parameters: mode - to update map onScaleChanged(float scale) ¶ public void onScaleChanged ( float scale ) onSingleTapConfirmed(android.view.MotionEvent event) ¶ public boolean onSingleTapConfirmed ( android . view . MotionEvent event ) Notified on map tapped Parameters: event - MotionEvent of tap event Returns: true if event is consumed, false otherwise onTouchEvent(android.view.MotionEvent event) ¶ public boolean onTouchEvent ( android . view . MotionEvent event ) Handles touch event on this view Parameters: event - previewLevel(int level) ¶ public void previewLevel ( int level ) Sets visible level on the map as given level Parameters: level - to preview on screen previewLevel(int level, boolean force) ¶ public void previewLevel ( int level , boolean force ) Sets visible level on the map as given level Parameters: level - to preview on screen force - reloads components on the screen by force even if same level is visible realignDrawable(MapDrawable drawable) ¶ public void realignDrawable ( MapDrawable drawable ) Refreshes given drawable Parameters: drawable - drawable to refresh realignDrawables() ¶ public void realignDrawables () Refreshes all drawables rebindDrawablesForCurrentLevel() ¶ public void rebindDrawablesForCurrentLevel () Reload current markers for current level refreshDrawable(MapDrawable drawable) ¶ public void refreshDrawable ( MapDrawable drawable ) Refreshes given drawable Parameters: drawable - to refresh refreshDrawables() ¶ public void refreshDrawables () Refreshes all map drawables refreshView() ¶ public void refreshView () Invalidates all map drawables removeDrawable(MapDrawable item) ¶ public void removeDrawable ( MapDrawable item ) Removes view of given MapDrawable Parameters: item - to remove view for removeDrawables(List mapDrawables) ¶ public void removeDrawables ( List < MapDrawable > mapDrawables ) Removes given map drawables Parameters: mapDrawables - list of drawables removeListener(MapView.Listener listener) ¶ public void removeListener ( MapView . Listener listener ) Removes map interaction observer listener Specified by: removeListener in interface Advertiser Parameters: listener - A listener of type MapView.Listener requestViewForDrawable(MapDrawable drawable) ¶ public android . view . View requestViewForDrawable ( MapDrawable drawable ) Requests view for given drawable Parameters: drawable - to get view Returns: View related to given drawable resume() ¶ public void resume () rotateCanvasWithUserPinView(Position userPosition) ¶ public void rotateCanvasWithUserPinView ( Position userPosition ) Rotates canvas with given position according to map mpde Parameters: userPosition - position scrollToAndNearCenter(int x, int y) ¶ public void scrollToAndNearCenter ( int x , int y ) Scrolls and centers to the x and y values provided with near-centering. Parameters: x - Horizontal destination point. y - Vertical destination point. setCenterX(float centerX) ¶ public void setCenterX ( float centerX ) Sets centerX Parameters: centerX - value setCenterY(float centerY) ¶ public void setCenterY ( float centerY ) Sets centerY Parameters: centerY - value setCurrentLevel(int level) ¶ public void setCurrentLevel ( int level ) Sets current level to display, Updates map given level Parameters: level - current level setCurrentLocation(CalculatedLocation currentCalculatedLocation) ¶ public void setCurrentLocation ( CalculatedLocation currentCalculatedLocation ) Sets current location Parameters: currentCalculatedLocation - current locaiton setCurrentPath(Path path) ¶ public void setCurrentPath ( Path path ) Sets current path Parameters: path - path setCurrentPosition(Position position) ¶ @Deprecated public void setCurrentPosition ( Position position ) Deprecated. replaced by setCurrentLocation(CalculatedLocation location) setForcedFacility(Facility facility) ¶ public void setForcedFacility ( Facility facility ) Changes facility to other than the one in configuration. Parameters: facility - Facility object to set as forced facility setIsFirstMapShown(Boolean isFirstMapShown) ¶ public void setIsFirstMapShown ( Boolean isFirstMapShown ) setMapViewProvider(MapViewProvider mapViewProvider) ¶ public void setMapViewProvider ( MapViewProvider mapViewProvider ) Sets drawable view binder which will be triggered on necessary drawable displaying adjustments occur. Parameters: mapViewProvider - the poi view binder setPoiViewFilter(POIViewFilter poiViewFilter) ¶ public void setPoiViewFilter ( POIViewFilter poiViewFilter ) Set external POIViewFilter to resolve POI clashes Parameters: poiViewFilter - POIViewFilter object setRotational(boolean rotatable) ¶ public void setRotational ( boolean rotatable ) This method will set whether the map is rotatable setScaleForFill() ¶ public void setScaleForFill () Computes the fill and changes scale accordingly and scrolls to map center shouldForceTracking() ¶ public boolean shouldForceTracking () Should force tracking boolean. Returns: the boolean showMapIfNotShownYet() ¶ public void showMapIfNotShownYet () Performs required operations to show the map if not shown previously updateMapForCurrentLevel() ¶ public void updateMapForCurrentLevel () Updates map for currentLevel see setCurrentLevel(int) to set current level zoomTo(int zoomRate) ¶ public void zoomTo ( int zoomRate ) Zoom to wanted scale with a center pivot Parameters: zoomRate - should be larger than 0. zoomTo(int zoomRate, float pivotX, float pivotY) ¶ public void zoomTo ( int zoomRate , float pivotX , float pivotY ) Zoom to given level such that zoomTo(3) is three times larger than zoom level 1 Parameters: zoomRate - should be positive. zoomTo(1) : minimum zoom level that map fits inside screen pivotX - x of pivot point pivotY - y of pivot point zoomToCurrentPosition(Position position) ¶ public void zoomToCurrentPosition ( Position position ) Zooms to given position Parameters: position - Position to zoom to

Context context ) This method converts device specific pixels to density independent pixels. Parameters: px - A value in px (pixels) unit. Which we need to convert into db context - Context to get resources and device specific display metrics Returns: A float value to represent dp equivalent to px value convertPixelsToDp(float px, float density) ¶ public static float convertPixelsToDp ( float px , float density ) Convert pixels to dp float. Parameters: px - the px density - the density Returns: the float

docs.text: public enum GpsPriority extends Enum ¶ This enum specifies the Priority Gps updates will be requested in. noPower: This allows the app to take no power blame for the gps location requests, however, it cannot request location in wanted interval, it can only receive location update if another app in the device receives location. In a way, it is piggybacking on other app’s location requests. If this priority is used, the app may not receive GPS Location for hours. City accuracy. balancedPower: This uses cell towers for GpsLocation updates and it requests location in the specified period. Within the OS allowed limit. With this priority, some power blame is taken, however it is safe to use. Does not warn the device user of battery drainage. It’s block level accuracy. — Pointr Recommended — highAccuracy: This uses cell towers and GPS satelites for GPS location updates. It has the best accuracy, along with very high battery drainage. If this priority is used for a long time, the device may overheat and suffer batter problems. For more information; balancedPower : https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/location/LocationRequest.html#PRIORITY_BALANCED_POWER_ACCURACY noPower : https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/location/LocationRequest.html#PRIORITY_NO_POWER highAccuracy : https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/location/LocationRequest.html#PRIORITY_HIGH_ACCURACY Enumerated Values ¶ balancedPower ¶ public static final GpsPriority balancedPower highAccuracy ¶ public static final GpsPriority highAccuracy noPower ¶ public static final GpsPriority noPower Class Methods ¶ valueOf(String name) ¶ public static GpsPriority valueOf ( String name ) Returns the enum constant of this type with the specified name. The string must match exactly an identifier used to declare an enum constant in this type. (Extraneous whitespace characters are not permitted.) Parameters: name - the name of the enum constant to be returned. Returns: the enum constant with the specified name Throws: IllegalArgumentException - if this enum type has no constant with the specified name NullPointerException - if the argument is null values() ¶ public static GpsPriority [] values () Returns an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared. This method may be used to iterate over the constants as follows: for ( GpsPriority c : GpsPriority . values ()) System . out . println ( c ); Returns: an array containing the constants of this enum type, in the order they are declared

In a way, it is piggybacking on other app’s location requests. If this priority is used, the app may not receive GPS Location for hours. City accuracy. balancedPower: This uses cell towers for GpsLocation updates and it requests location in the specified period. Within the OS allowed limit. With this priority, some power blame is taken, however it is safe to use. Does not warn the device user of battery drainage. It’s block level accuracy. — Pointr Recommended — highAccuracy: This uses cell towers and GPS satelites for GPS location updates. It has the best accuracy, along with very high battery drainage. If this priority is used for a long time, the device may overheat and suffer batter problems. For more information; balancedPower : https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/location/LocationRequest.html#PRIORITY_BALANCED_POWER_ACCURACY noPower : https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/location/LocationRequest.html#PRIORITY_NO_POWER highAccuracy : https://developers.google.com/android/reference/com/google/android/gms/location/LocationRequest.html#PRIORITY_HIGH_ACCURACY

docs.text: PTRLibraryHelper ¶ Inherits from NSObject Declared in PTRLibraryHelper.h Overview ¶ Static class including helper methods for Pointr Engine Class Methods ¶ alphabetOnlyLowercaseStringFromString: ¶ Strips string of any character other than alphabetic and returns(eg. numbers, spaces, symbols) Converts accents also (eg. é -> e) Used to match string from Pointr Cloud mainly + ( NSString * ) alphabetOnlyLowercaseStringFromString: ( NSString * ) * string * Parameters: string string to be stripped Returns: NSString alphabetic representation of given string findAngleBetweenTwoPointsWithX1:y1:x2:y2: ¶ Finds angle between two points + ( float ) findAngleBetweenTwoPointsWithX1: ( float ) * x1 * y1 :( float ) * y1 * x2 :( float ) * x2 * y2 :( float ) * y2 * Parameters: x1 x for 1 st point y1 y for 1 st point x2 x for 2 nd point y2 y for 2 nd point Returns: the angle of vector (x2,y2) -> (x1,y1) in radians, in coordinate system: (0,0) top-left, (1,1) bottom-right; angle 0 north, increasing clockwise isOldDevice ¶ Returns YES if device has poor CPU/memory. NO otherwise. This flag is used to determine whether low memory mode should be activated. + ( BOOL ) isOldDevice searchFriendlyString: ¶ Return search-friendly version of given string, lowercase and without accents (eg. è -> e) Used to create search tokens mainly + ( NSString * _Nullable ) searchFriendlyString: ( NSString * ) * str * Parameters: str string to make friendly Returns: NSString search friendly string stringForLevel: ¶ Return string representation of level + ( NSString * ) stringForLevel: ( int ) * level * Parameters: level level Returns: NSString string representation of level

docs.text: PointrBase ¶ Inherits from PTRAdvertiser Conforms to < > PointrBaseDelegate id Declared in PointrBase.h Overview ¶ Main Pointr Class to interact with start callbacks and managers. Properties ¶ isCrashHandlingEnabled ¶ isCrashHandlingEnabled Flag to control whether Pointr internal crash handling is enabled or not. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL isCrashHandlingEnabled YES by default. loggerLevel ¶ loggerLevel Indicates library start state @property ( nonatomic , assign ) PTRLoggerLevel loggerLevel mode ¶ mode The running mode for Pointr SDK @property ( nonatomic , strong ) PointrMode * mode networkCoordinator ¶ networkCoordinator Specified Network Coordinator to post/recieve data used by Pointr Engine @property ( nonatomic , strong , readonly ) PTRNetworkCoordinator * networkCoordinator state ¶ state Indicates library start state @property ( nonatomic , readonly ) PointrState state storage ¶ storage Internal Data Storage of Pointr Engine @property ( nonatomic , strong , readonly ) PTRStorage * storage version ¶ version Version number for this library @property ( nonatomic , readonly ) NSString * version Instance Methods ¶ getAnalyticsManager ¶ Allows access to the shared instance for Analytics manager - PTRAlertViewTypeSuccess PTRAlertViewTypeSuccess: Green main color Scheme with tick on alertView. PTRAlertViewTypeInfo PTRAlertViewTypeInfo: Blue main color with i on alertView. PTRAlertViewTypeYesNo PTRAlertViewTypeYesNo: Red and Green buttoned alertView. PTRAlertViewTypeVisitPage PTRAlertViewTypeVisitPage: Done action sends to link property. PTRAlertViewTypeRating PTRAlertViewTypeRating: Orange main color Scheme with star rating. PTRAlertViewTypeWithoutButton PTRAlertViewTypeWithoutButton: Simple description alertView.

docs.text: PTRLocationSharingNotificationType ¶ Declared in PTRLocationSharingTypes.h PTRLocationSharingNotificationType ¶ This enum is to specify the wanted notification type to share the location Definition ¶ typedef NS_ENUM(int, PTRLocationSharingNotificationType ) { PTRLocationSharingNotificationTypeManual = 0, PTRLocationSharingNotificationTypeEmail = 1, PTRLocationSharingNotificationTypeSMS = 2, PTRLocationSharingNotificationTypePush = 3, }; Constants ¶ PTRLocationSharingNotificationTypeManual This type signifies that the location sharing token will be given to user, and they will need to share the key with others manually PTRLocationSharingNotificationTypeEmail This type signifies that the location sharing token will be shared with wanted parties via mail PTRLocationSharingNotificationTypeSMS This type signifies that the location sharing token will be shared with wanted parties via SMS PTRLocationSharingNotificationTypePush This type signifies that the location sharing token will be shared with wanted parties via Push notification (NOT SUPPORTED IN V5)

docs.text: PTRLocationSharingNotificationTypeManual This type signifies that the location sharing token will be given to user, and they will need to share the key with others manually PTRLocationSharingNotificationTypeEmail This type signifies that the location sharing token will be shared with wanted parties via mail PTRLocationSharingNotificationTypeSMS This type signifies that the location sharing token will be shared with wanted parties via SMS PTRLocationSharingNotificationTypePush This type signifies that the location sharing token will be shared with wanted parties via Push notification (NOT SUPPORTED IN V5)

docs.text: PTRLocationSharingPeerType ¶ Declared in PTRLocationSharingTypes.h PTRLocationSharingPeerType ¶ This enum signifies how the location sharing session will be peered Definition ¶ typedef NS_ENUM(int, PTRLocationSharingPeerType ) { PTRLocationSharingPeerTypeUnknown = 0, PTRLocationSharingPeerTypeGroup = 1, PTRLocationSharingPeerTypeGeofence = 2, PTRLocationSharingPeerTypeAll = 3, }; Constants ¶ PTRLocationSharingPeerTypeUnknown This signifies that no peer type has been set PTRLocationSharingPeerTypeGroup This signifies that groups with same token will be sharing&receiving location PTRLocationSharingPeerTypeGeofence This signifies that the users which register to the same geofence will share&receive location PTRLocationSharingPeerTypeAll This signifies that the location will be shared all the time with every user

docs.text: PTRNodeType ¶ Declared in PTRNodeInterface.h PTRNodeType ¶ Types of nodes used for pathfinding and turn by turn directions. Definition ¶ typedef NS_ENUM(int, PTRNodeType ) { PTRNodeTypeUnknown, PTRNodeTypeRegular, PTRNodeTypeRotation, PTRNodeTypeTurn, PTRNodeTypeLift, PTRNodeTypeEscalator, PTRNodeTypeTravelator, PTRNodeTypeAngularStairs, PTRNodeTypeRotationalStairs, PTRNodeTypeServiceLift, PTRNodeTypeSecurityControl, PTRNodeTypeBorderControl, PTRNodeTypeRamp, PTRNodeTypeSteps, PTRNodeTypeServiceStairs, PTRNodeTypeTrain, PTRNodeTypeShuttle, PTRNodeTypeMetro, }; Constants ¶ PTRNodeTypeUnknown Not initialised PTRNodeTypeRegular Regular walking node PTRNodeTypeRotation Fake node to indicate rotation (eg. “rotate left”) PTRNodeTypeTurn Regular walking node, with a turn (eg. “turn left”) PTRNodeTypeLift Lift PTRNodeTypeEscalator Escalator PTRNodeTypeTravelator Walking band / slide PTRNodeTypeAngularStairs Stairs with an angle (different x,y on different floors) PTRNodeTypeRotationalStairs Staircase (same x,y on each floor) PTRNodeTypeServiceLift Lift for service / internal use PTRNodeTypeSecurityControl Security checkpoint (eg. at the airport entrance) PTRNodeTypeBorderControl Border control checkpoint (eg. at the immigration border) PTRNodeTypeRamp Ramp PTRNodeTypeSteps Small steps on a floor PTRNodeTypeServiceStairs Stairs for service PTRNodeTypeTrain Train PTRNodeTypeShuttle Shuttle Bus PTRNodeTypeMetro Subway

docs.text: PTRPathDirectionType ¶ Declared in PTRPathDirection.h PTRPathDirectionType ¶ Types of Directions to give Definition ¶ typedef NS_ENUM(NSInteger, PTRPathDirectionType ) { PTRPathDirectionGoStraight, PTRPathDirectionTurnSlightLeftAndKeepStraight, PTRPathDirectionTurnLeft, PTRPathDirectionTurnSlightRightAndKeepStraight, PTRPathDirectionTurnRight, PTRPathDirectionChangeLevel, PTRPathDirectionRotateBack, PTRPathDirectionRotateLeft, PTRPathDirectionRotateRight, PTRPathDirectionPrepareToTurnRight, PTRPathDirectionPrepareToTurnLeft, PTRPathDirectionChangeFacility, PTRPathDirectionSecurity, PTRPathDirectionBorderControl, }; Constants ¶ PTRPathDirectionGoStraight For a path segment where user is to move in a straight line PTRPathDirectionTurnSlightLeftAndKeepStraight For a path segment where user is to move slightly left and then keep going in a straight line PTRPathDirectionTurnLeft For a path segment where user is to turn to the left PTRPathDirectionTurnSlightRightAndKeepStraight For a path segment where user is to move slightly right and then keep going in a straight line PTRPathDirectionTurnRight For a path segment where user is to turn to the right PTRPathDirectionChangeLevel For a path segment where user is to change level PTRPathDirectionRotateBack For a path segment where user is to rotate backwards PTRPathDirectionRotateLeft For a path segment where user is to rotate left PTRPathDirectionRotateRight For a path segment where user is to rotate right PTRPathDirectionPrepareToTurnRight For a path segment where user is to prepare to turn to the right PTRPathDirectionPrepareToTurnLeft For a path segment where user is to prepare to turn to the left PTRPathDirectionChangeFacility For a path segment where user will change facility PTRPathDirectionSecurity For a special path segment that requires user to enter special security zone PTRPathDirectionBorderControl For a special path segment that requires user to pass through a border control zone

Definition ¶ typedef NS_ENUM(int, PTRPathfindingMode ) { PTRPathfindingModeNormal, PTRPathfindingModeEasy, PTRPathfindingModeAccessible, }; Constants ¶ PTRPathfindingModeNormal Default mode : Shortest path available PTRPathfindingModeEasy May use some steps and may not be the shortest available path but relatively comfortable path for families and elderly. PTRPathfindingModeAccessible Does not include any steps in paths. It is the most comfortable path for people with having difficulty with walking.

docs.text: PTRMapView ¶ Inherits from UIView Declared in PTRMapView.h Overview ¶ The standard Map View implementation for maps and navigation Properties ¶ currentFacility ¶ currentFacility The current facility mapView showing @property ( nonatomic , readonly ) int currentFacility currentLevel ¶ currentLevel The current level displayed on the map view. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) int currentLevel Warning setCurrentLevel does nothing if mapView.currentLevel is equals to given value and link[#isFirstMapShown] is true currentLocation ¶ currentLocation The current position given to mapView @property ( atomic , strong ) PTRCalculatedLocation * currentLocation currentMapMode ¶ currentMapMode The current map mode. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) PTRMapMode currentMapMode dataSource ¶ dataSource The object that acts as Data Source of the Map View This object must conform to the PTRMapViewDataSource protocol @property ( nonatomic , weak ) _Nullable id < PTRMapViewDataSource > dataSource forcedFacilityId ¶ forcedFacilityId Use to set a facility to force INVALID_FACILITY by default @property ( nonatomic ) int forcedFacilityId isFirstMapShown ¶ isFirstMapShown Turns to YES after first map is displayed on venue @property ( nonatomic ) BOOL isFirstMapShown layoutLimits ¶ layoutLimits Frame of showable area in mapView content @property ( nonatomic ) CGRect layoutLimits Other areas exist but can not scroll to those areas Use display area poi for setting layoutLimits dynamically levelChangeAnimationType ¶ levelChangeAnimationType PTRMapLevelChangeAnimationType Level Change Animation Type : [Default is Centralised] @property ( atomic , assign ) PTRMapLevelChangeAnimationType levelChangeAnimationType loadingState ¶ loadingState The current load state of MapView @property ( nonatomic , assign ) PTRMapLoadingState loadingState maximumZoomScale ¶ maximumZoomScale Maximum zoom supported by the map view @property ( nonatomic , assign ) float maximumZoomScale minimumZoomScale ¶ minimumZoomScale Minimum zoom supported by the map view @property ( nonatomic , assign ) float minimumZoomScale path ¶ path Path object of mapview set it for draw and refresh path Set path to nil for deleting it @property ( nonatomic , strong ) PTRPath * path screenRect ¶ screenRect Frame of mapView content, used for map algoritms @property ( nonatomic , readonly ) CGRect screenRect shouldAllowMapRotation ¶ shouldAllowMapRotation Enable/Disable Map Rotation @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL shouldAllowMapRotation shouldShowJoyStick ¶ shouldShowJoyStick Displays joystickView if YES @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL shouldShowJoyStick Instance Methods ¶ addDrawable: ¶ Adds the given drawable to the map view. - ( void ) addDrawable: ( id < PTRMapDrawable > ) * drawable * Parameters: drawable PTRMapDrawable object to add to map. addDrawables: ¶ Adds the given list of drawables to the map view. - ( void ) addDrawables: ( NSArray < id < PTRMapDrawable > > * ) * drawables * Parameters: drawables An array of PTRMapDrawable objects. addListener: ¶ Adds listener to receive callbacks - ( void ) addListener: ( id < PTRMapViewDelegate > ) * listener * Parameters: listener An object which conforms to PTRPositionManagerDelegate protocol centerMapToPosition: ¶ Centers map to Position without zooming And setting level of position - ( void ) centerMapToPosition: ( PTRPosition ) * position * Parameters: position PTRPosition object to centering area contentSize ¶ Returns current content size of map Returns 0,0 if tile and raster map are not available - ( CGSize ) contentSize Returns: CGSize size of content drawableWithIdentifier: ¶ Returns the drawable with given identifier - ( id < PTRMapDrawable > ) drawableWithIdentifier: ( NSString * ) * identifier * Parameters: identifier identifier of drawable Returns: drawable object isDrawableExist: ¶ Chack if given drawable exist for map - ( BOOL ) isDrawableExist: ( id < PTRMapDrawable > ) * drawable * Parameters: drawable PTRMapDrawable object to chack in map Returns: Boolean to send if drawable exist for map isPointVisibleInMap: ¶ Returns if given point visible on mapViews frame - ( BOOL ) isPointVisibleInMap: ( CGPoint ) * point * Parameters: point CGPoint of asked position Returns: bool is inside isScrolling ¶ Returns if map is scrolling at the moment - ( BOOL ) isScrolling Returns: BOOL YES if map is scrolling, NO otherwise isZooming ¶ Returns if map is zooming at the moment - ( BOOL ) isZooming Returns: BOOL YES if map is zooming, NO otherwise realignDrawable: ¶ Corrects position of drawable and view without deleting the view - ( void ) realignDrawable: ( id < PTRMapDrawable > ) * drawable * realignDrawables ¶ Corrects position of all drawables and views without deleting the view - ( void ) realignDrawables refreshAllDrawables ¶ Deletes all views and layers even from the cache and add them again viewForDrawable and layerForRegionDrawable callbacks will called when dawables will be on screen - ( void ) refreshAllDrawables refreshDrawable: ¶ Deletes views and layer even from the cache and add drawable again viewForDrawable and layerForRegionDrawable callbacks will called when drawable will be on screen - ( void ) refreshDrawable: ( id < PTRMapDrawable > ) * drawable * removeAllDrawables ¶ Removes all drawables and views for drawables Clears cache for views too if it will be added again callback viewfor drawable will called again - ( void ) removeAllDrawables removeDrawable: ¶ Remove the given drawable and its view from map view. Clears cache for view too if it will be added again callback viewfor drawable will called again - ( void ) removeDrawable: ( id < PTRMapDrawable > ) * drawable * Parameters: drawable PTRMapDrawable object to remove from map. removeDrawables: ¶ Removes the given list of drawables and their views from map view. Clears cache for views too if it will be added again callback viewfor drawable will called again - ( void ) removeDrawables: ( NSArray < id < PTRMapDrawable > > * ) * drawables * Parameters: drawables An array of PTRMapDrawable objects. removeListener: ¶ Removes listener to receive callbacks - ( void ) removeListener: ( id < PTRMapViewDelegate > ) * listener * Parameters: listener An object which conforms to PTRPositionManagerDelegate protocol resetRotationOfMapAndDrawables ¶ Reset map and drawables to original rotation value - ( void ) resetRotationOfMapAndDrawables setMapContentCenterIfAvailableToCoordinate: ¶ Centers map with given coordinate - ( void ) setMapContentCenterIfAvailableToCoordinate: ( CGPoint ) * coordinate * Parameters: coordinate CGPoint of where to put userPin setMinimumZoomScaleWithPredefinedValue: ¶ Sets minimum zoom scale to a predefined value Needed float value to give aspect fill or fit will be calculated automatıcally in funct - ( void ) setMinimumZoomScaleWithPredefinedValue: ( PTRMapViewMinimumZoomScale ) * value * Parameters: value enum from PTRMapViewMinimumZoomScale show ¶ Shows the map. - ( void ) show tiledMap ¶ Tiled Map View Layer in Map - ( PTRTiledMapView * ) tiledMap Returns: PTRTiledMapView tryRotateCanvasWithUserPinCoordinates: ¶ Rotates map and drawables if rotation available - ( void ) tryRotateCanvasWithUserPinCoordinates: ( CGPoint ) * userPinScreenCoordinates * Parameters: userPinScreenCoordinates CGPoint of where to put userPin viewWithDrawable: ¶ Function to get View from drawable Returns both visible or recycled views - ( UIView * ) viewWithDrawable: ( id < PTRMapDrawable > ) * drawable * Parameters: drawable drawable for already created view Returns: UIView for given drawable zoomScale ¶ Returns current zoom scale of tiled map or rasterMap Warning returns INVALID_ZOOM if no map is shown - ( float ) zoomScale Returns: float zoomScale zoomViewToCurrentPosition ¶ Sets the zoom to user’s current location. - ( void ) zoomViewToCurrentPosition zoomViewToDrawable: ¶ Zooms the map view to selected POI at maps half zoom level. - ( void ) zoomViewToDrawable: ( id < PTRMapDrawable > ) * drawable * Parameters: drawable PTRMapDrawable to zoom zoomViewToDrawable:zoomLevel: ¶ Zooms the map view to selected drawable at given zoom scale - ( void ) zoomViewToDrawable: ( id < PTRMapDrawable > ) * drawable * zoomLevel :( float ) * zoomLevel * Parameters: drawable PTRMapDrawable to zoom zoomLevel desired zoom value zoomViewToX:andY: ¶ Sets the zoom to the given x and y - ( void ) zoomViewToX: ( float ) * x * andY :( float ) * y * Parameters: x zoom position at x axis value between (0,1) y zoom position at y axis value between (0,1) zoomViewToX:andY:withZoomLevel: ¶ Sets the zoom to the given location at the given zoom level - ( void ) zoomViewToX: ( float ) * x * andY :( float ) * y * withZoomLevel :( float ) * zoomLevel * Parameters: x zoom position at x axis value between (0,1) y zoom position at y axis value between (0,1) zoomLevel desired zoom level

docs.text: PTRApiResponse ¶ Inherits from NSObject Declared in PTRApiResponse.h Overview ¶ Main response object that will be received from all the Network related requests. Properties ¶ body ¶ body Optional (typically NSArray or NSDictionary or NSData) @property ( nonatomic , retain , nullable ) NSObject * body debugErrorMessage ¶ debugErrorMessage For debugging only (optional). @property ( nonatomic , retain ) NSString * debugErrorMessage errorMessage ¶ errorMessage Human friendly error mesages (optional). @property ( nonatomic , retain ) NSString * errorMessage statusCode ¶ statusCode Status code as returned from Pointr Cloud. -1 if invalid. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) int statusCode strData ¶ strData String Json data for C++ parsing. @property ( nonatomic , retain ) NSString * strData Instance Methods ¶ authenticationFailed ¶ Used to check if at any point within the program the server returns 401 This means the authentication has failed. - ( BOOL ) authenticationFailed Returns: YES if authentication is require, NO otherwise. initWithDictionary: ¶ Default initialiser to create a response object. - ( instancetype ) initWithDictionary: ( NSDictionary * ) * dictionary * Parameters: dictionary The dictionary received from server as JSON. Returns: A PTRResponse object parsed from dictionary, or nil. initWithErrorMessage:andDebugErrorMessage: ¶ Default initialiser to create an error response manually. - ( instancetype ) initWithErrorMessage: ( NSString * ) * errorMessage * andDebugErrorMessage :( NSString * ) * debugErrorMessage * Parameters: errorMessage String representing the error issue debugErrorMessage A more technical description of the error. Returns: A PTRResponse object, or nil. isSuccessful ¶ A convenience method to check if the received response has been successful. - ( BOOL ) isSuccessful Returns: YES if request is successful, NO otherwise.
docs.title: PTRApiResponse

docs.text: PTRFacilityConfiguration ¶ Inherits from PTRConfigurationInterface : NSObject Declared in PTRFacilityConfiguration.h Overview ¶ This configuration holds the configurable items for facilities. They can be set via BaseConfiguration.json or through PointrCloud. The values of these items can be modified at any time by changing the value on PointrCloud and the SDK will fetch the updated configuration, forcing the new value throughout the SDK. The items regarding the latitude and longitude are world coordinates of the physical map of the facility, which is a square. These values are used to convert Pointr coordinates to world coordinates. If third party wants to get the latitude and longitude values of user position calculated by the Pointr Engine, it needs to give valid values to the latitudetopleft , longitudetopleft , latitudetopright , longitudetopright , latitudebottomleft , longitudebottomleft Properties ¶ externalIdentifier ¶ externalIdentifier External (customer) identifier of facility @property ( nonatomic , retain ) NSString * externalIdentifier headingOffset ¶ headingOffset The offset between magnetic north and the top of the facility map @property ( nonatomic , assign ) float headingOffset internalIdentifier ¶ internalIdentifier Numeric internal ( Pointr ) identifier of facility @property ( nonatomic , assign ) int internalIdentifier isValid ¶ isValid Checks and returns if the configuration is valid @property ( nonatomic , readonly ) BOOL isValid YES if configuration is valid (with valid height, width and min/max levels). NO otherwise. Note It is possible to initialise an invalid facility configuration with facilityId only. latitudeBottomLeft ¶ Latitude of the bottom left of map @property ( nonatomic , assign ) double latitudeBottomLeft latitudeTopLeft ¶ Latitude of top left point of map @property ( nonatomic , assign ) double latitudeTopLeft latitudeTopRight ¶ Latitude of top right point of map @property ( nonatomic , assign ) double latitudeTopRight longitudeBottomLeft ¶ Longitude of the bottom left of map @property ( nonatomic , assign ) double longitudeBottomLeft longitudeTopLeft ¶ Longitude of top left point of map @property ( nonatomic , assign ) double longitudeTopLeft longitudeTopRight ¶ Longitude of top right point of map @property ( nonatomic , assign ) double longitudeTopRight mapHeightMeters ¶ mapHeightInMeters Real life height of the map area.[Default 100.0] @property ( nonatomic , assign ) float mapHeightMeters mapMaxLevel ¶ mapMaxLevel Map’s highest level @property ( nonatomic , assign ) int mapMaxLevel The maximum available level in the facility. Higher limit of the levels to be used. If third parties try to show a level higher than this value, the Pointr Engine will error, signaling the top limit has been exceeded. E.g. mapMaxLevel = 5, and third party tries to show level = 7, Pointr Engine will show blank screen or the existing screen, and log that the wanted level is higher than maximum limit in facility. mapMinLevel ¶ mapMinLevel Map’s lowest level @property ( nonatomic , assign ) int mapMinLevel The minimum available level in the facility. Lower limit of the levels to be used. If third parties try to show a level smaller than this value, the Pointr Engine will error, signaling the bottom limit has been passed. E.g. mapMinLevel = 0, and third party tries to show level = -1, Pointr Engine will show blank screen or the existing screen, and log that the wanted level is smaller than minimum limit in facility. mapWidthMeters ¶ mapWidthMeters Real life width of the map area.[Default 100.0] @property ( nonatomic , assign ) float mapWidthMeters name ¶ name Name of facility, used in welcome message. @property ( nonatomic , strong ) NSString * name
docs.title: PTRFacilityConfiguration

docs.text: PTRGeofenceManagerConfiguration ¶ Inherits from PTRConfigurationInterface : NSObject Declared in PTRGeofenceManagerConfiguration.h Overview ¶ Notificaiton and geofence enter exit related configuration items. Properties ¶ exitPushMessage ¶ exitPushMessage The popup message to appear upon exiting a facility. This will be shown only if enabled. See link[#shouldNotifyWithPushMessage] @property ( nonatomic , retain ) NSString * exitPushMessage geofenceEventDetectionTimeoutInSeconds ¶ geofenceEventDetectionTimeoutInSeconds This config item lets third parties decide the time between notifications of different geofencing events ((enter->exit) or (exit->enter)) Geofence Event Detection Timeout in seconds [Default: 60] @property ( nonatomic , assign ) int geofenceEventDetectionTimeoutInSeconds geofenceEventReplayTimeoutInMinutes ¶ geofenceEventReplayTimeoutInMinutes This config item lets third parties decide the time between notifications of same geofencing events ((enter->enter) or (exit->exit)) @property ( nonatomic , assign ) int geofenceEventReplayTimeoutInMinutes Timeout for re-send same event for geofences [Default: 120] geofenceUpdateThresholdMeters ¶ geofenceUpdateTheresholdMeters Update nearest geofence regions based on calculated position.[Default: 5000] @property ( nonatomic , assign ) int geofenceUpdateThresholdMeters isAutomaticFacilitySwitchEnabled ¶ isAutomaticFacilitySwitchEnabled This config item signifies if the third party wants Pointr Engine to switch facility automa- tically upon hearing beacons. When enabled, Pointr Engine will understand which facility the user is in from the beacons in the vicinity, and switch the SDK to the heard facility. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL isAutomaticFacilitySwitchEnabled YES by default. isEnabled ¶ isEnabled Indicates if geofencing is enabled. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL isEnabled maxNumberOfGeofencesToRegister ¶ maxNumberOfGeofencesToRegister Max Number of Geofence Regions To Register[Default: 19] If beacon regions will be used number of UUIDs should be excluded. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) int maxNumberOfGeofencesToRegister notifyApi ¶ notifyApi Relative endpoint to which enter/exit notify requests are sent to. @property ( nonatomic , retain ) NSString * notifyApi regionTimeoutInterval ¶ regionTimeoutInterval Number of seconds before library assumes the user exited the region @property ( nonatomic , assign ) double regionTimeoutInterval shouldNotifyEnterExit ¶ shouldNotifyEnterExit This is a config item to let the third party decide if Pointr Engine should notify the user upon its enter/exit facility events. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL shouldNotifyEnterExit shouldNotifyServer ¶ shouldNotifyServer This is a config item to let the third party decide if Pointr Engine should notify the server upon enter/exit facility events of the user. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL shouldNotifyServer shouldNotifyWithPushMessage ¶ shouldNotifyWithPushMessage YES if Push messages will be used. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL shouldNotifyWithPushMessage welcomePushMessage ¶ welcomePushMessage The popup message to appear upon entering a facility. This will be shown only if enabled. See link[#shouldNotifyWithPushMessage] @property ( nonatomic , retain ) NSString * welcomePushMessage

docs.text: PTRLocationSharingConfiguration ¶ Inherits from PTRConfigurationInterface : NSObject Declared in PTRLocationSharingConfiguration.h Overview ¶ This class holds configuration items for location sharing Properties ¶ advertisementIntervalInSeconds ¶ advertisementIntervalInSeconds Time interval of Online Location Advertisement @property ( nonatomic , assign ) double advertisementIntervalInSeconds isOnlineLocationSharingEnabled ¶ isOnlineLocationSharingEnabled Enable Location Sharing Manager[YES by Default] @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL isOnlineLocationSharingEnabled isSeeOtherPeopleOnlineEnabled ¶ isSeeOtherPeopleOnlineEnabled See other devices through data received from server.[NO by default] @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL isSeeOtherPeopleOnlineEnabled locationUploadApi ¶ locationUploadApi Endpoint for sending user locations to server. @property ( nonatomic , retain ) NSString * locationUploadApi maxAgeAssetLocationsInSeconds ¶ maxAgeAssetLocationsInSeconds Oldest time for retrieving online asset locations in seconds.[Default: 1 hour] @property ( nonatomic , assign ) double maxAgeAssetLocationsInSeconds maxAgeOnlineLocationsInSeconds ¶ maxAgeOnlineLocationsInSeconds Oldest time for retrieving online locations in seconds.[Default: 1 hour] @property ( nonatomic , assign ) double maxAgeOnlineLocationsInSeconds onlineLocationPollApi ¶ onlineLocationPollApi Endpoint for getting other user’s locations from server. @property ( nonatomic , strong ) NSString * onlineLocationPollApi onlineLocationPollFrequencyInSeconds ¶ onlineLocationPollFrequencyInSeconds The cycle period the online positions will be received @property ( nonatomic , assign ) double onlineLocationPollFrequencyInSeconds onlineLocationTimeoutInSeconds ¶ onlineLocationTimeoutInSeconds Timout of Sharing Location Online in seconds @property ( nonatomic , assign ) double onlineLocationTimeoutInSeconds positionSamplingRateInSeconds ¶ positionSamplingRateInSeconds Sample rate for uploaded positions to server. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) double positionSamplingRateInSeconds positionUploadIntervalInSeconds ¶ positionUploadIntervalInSeconds The cycle time for position uploader will upload saved positions. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) double positionUploadIntervalInSeconds seeOtherPeopleTimeoutInSeconds ¶ seeOtherPeopleTimeoutInSeconds See other people active in last X seconds [Default: 60 seconds] Warning For online sharing, effective timeout might go up to twice as much (as we’re caching on server as well as on device). For offline sharing, effective timeout will be equal to this value. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) double seeOtherPeopleTimeoutInSeconds 60 seconds by default

docs.text: PTRPathManagerConfiguration ¶ Inherits from PTRConfigurationInterface : NSObject Declared in PTRPathManagerConfiguration.h Overview ¶ This class holds configuration information on pathfinding, and allows third party to customize their pathfinding experience. Properties ¶ arrivalThresholdInMetres ¶ arrivalThresholdInMetres The config item to specify the threshold the user needs to pass, in order for the Pointr Engine to accept it as arrived. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) float arrivalThresholdInMetres While doing pathfinding to a location, the physical user needs to be arrivalThresholdInMetres near the destination for the Engine to mark it as arrived. distanceMode ¶ distanceMode Can be set to special modes such as exhibition. [Normal by default] @property ( nonatomic , assign ) PTRPathfindingDistanceMode distanceMode isSmartReroutingEnabled ¶ isSmartReroutingEnabled This config item is to enable smart rerouting. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL isSmartReroutingEnabled Smart rerouting notifies the user with a better path if it is found. E.g. - User started pathfinding to POI, Pointr Engine calculated a path from its current location. - Then the user changed it’s location. And now there is an elevator next to the new location of the user, that goes much quicker to the destination. If this config item is enabled, Pointr Engine recalculates the path. isTurnByTurnDirectionsEnabled ¶ isTurnByTurnDirectionsEnabled Flag to turn on/off turn-by-turn directions. YES by default. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL isTurnByTurnDirectionsEnabled isVoiceGuidanceEnabled ¶ isVoiceGuidanceEnabled If enabled, turn by turn directions are accompanied with voice. ON by default. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL isVoiceGuidanceEnabled rerouteThresholdInMetres ¶ rerouteThresholdInMetres Reroute path if deviated from the path by X metres @property ( nonatomic , assign ) float rerouteThresholdInMetres
docs.title: PTRPathManagerConfiguration

docs.text: PTRSdkConfiguration ¶ Inherits from PTRConfigurationInterface : NSObject Declared in PTRSdkConfiguration.h Overview ¶ This class holds the base configuration information for the SDK Properties ¶ baseUrl ¶ baseUrl The endpoint that the SDK will use to register and fetch data from backend @property ( nonatomic , strong ) NSString * baseUrl The set method for the base url sets the property. Addition to the property all the related, download, upload and query URL’s are automatically set according to the base url. If any of these properties are required to be they can be set explicitly. beaconBrandName ¶ beaconBrandName The brand name of the beacon that the SDK will use. This will be used to differentiate on the API’s used to scan and decrypt beacon data. @property ( nonatomic , strong ) NSString * beaconBrandName Default is [kontakt] uuidList ¶ uuidList The list of all the UUID’s for all the venues of the customer @property ( nonatomic , strong ) NSArray < NSDictionary < NSNumber * NSString *> *> * uuidList Instance Methods ¶ isValid ¶ isValid Returns YES if all required fields are populated NO otherwise - ( BOOL ) isValid

docs.text: PTRUserInterfaceConfiguration ¶ Inherits from PTRConfigurationInterface : NSObject Declared in PTRUserInterfaceConfiguration.h Overview ¶ This class holds configuration items that are related with the User Interface. The third parties will be able to configure Pointr given UI elements with this class. Properties ¶ accuracyCircleMaxSizeInMeters ¶ accuracyCircleMaxSizeInMeters Maximum size of the accuracy circle around the pin. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) float accuracyCircleMaxSizeInMeters Be aware accuracy max size will be maximum 6x from blue dot in pixels So if pixel representation of MaxSizeInMeters is above this value it wont have an effect. accuracyCircleMinSizeInMeters ¶ accuracyCircleMinSizeInMeters Minimum size of the accuracy circle around the pin. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) float accuracyCircleMinSizeInMeters Be aware accuracy min size will be minimum 2x from blue dot in pixels So if pixel representation of MinSizeInMeters is below this value it wont have an effect. accuracyCirclePulseColour ¶ accuracyCirclePulseColour Color of the pulsating part of the accuracy circle around the pin. @property ( nonatomic , strong ) UIColor * accuracyCirclePulseColour accuracyCircleStaticColour ¶ accuracyCircleStaticColour Color of the static part of the accuracy circle around the pin. @property ( nonatomic , strong ) UIColor * accuracyCircleStaticColour enabledMapModes ¶ This item declares to the SDK the enabled map modes. It can be one of the following; @property ( nonatomic , strong ) NSArray * enabledMapModes Mode where user can navigate through whole map freely Free Mode where user can navigate through map but focuses current position if touch interaction will be idle for some period of time Tracking Mode where pin will be focused and no navigation will be allowed RotationalTracking Map rotates based on current path, ensuring path is always facing up Warning This mode should only be activated when there is an active path PathTracking By default all of the mapmodes will be enabled. isAugmentedRealityEnabled ¶ isAugmentedRealityEnabled Enables Augmented Reality functionality. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL isAugmentedRealityEnabled isDataDownloadPromptEnabled ¶ @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL isDataDownloadPromptEnabled isOnScreenTranslationEnabled ¶ isOnScreenTranslationEnabled Enables On Screen Translation functionality. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL isOnScreenTranslationEnabled isPathSimplificationEnabled ¶ isPathSimplificationEnabled Path simplification skips graph nodes for path, when it is feasible YES by default @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL isPathSimplificationEnabled mapRotationLimitAngleInDegrees ¶ @property ( nonatomic , assign ) float mapRotationLimitAngleInDegrees maxZoomScale ¶ @property ( nonatomic , assign ) float maxZoomScale maximumMapDetailLevel ¶ maximumMapDetailLevel Indicates the maximum zoom level of detail map will have. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) int maximumMapDetailLevel minZoomScale ¶ @property ( nonatomic , assign ) float minZoomScale orientationCircleColor ¶ orientationCircleColor Color of the static part of the accuracy circle around the pin. @property ( nonatomic , strong ) UIColor * orientationCircleColor pathWidth ¶ pathWidth Width of the line of drawn path on the map. Size of a dot when map path mode is dotted @property ( nonatomic , assign ) float pathWidth pinDisappearTime ¶ pinDisappearTime Dissapear time after fading out. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) float pinDisappearTime pinFadeOutTime ¶ pinFadeOutTime Fade out time when invalid position is supplied. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) float pinFadeOutTime shouldCheckAnnotationClash ¶ shouldCheckAnnotationClash Drawable clash prevention @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL shouldCheckAnnotationClash shouldEnableAccuracyCircle ¶ shouldEnableAccuracyCircle Determines if an accuracy circle should be used or not @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL shouldEnableAccuracyCircle shouldEnlargeSelectedPoi ¶ shouldEnlargeSelectedPoi Determines if a poi should enlarge when selected @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL shouldEnlargeSelectedPoi shouldShowDebuggingPanel ¶ shouldShowDebuggingPanel Decides if the debugging overlay will be shown on screen. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL shouldShowDebuggingPanel willShowMapFooter ¶ willShowMapFooter Determines if the footer with logo and mode changer should be visible or not. @property ( nonatomic , assign ) BOOL willShowMapFooter Instance Methods ¶ initWithDictionary: ¶ Initialisation method from JSON Dictionary. - ( instancetype ) initWithDictionary: ( NSDictionary * ) * dictionary * Parameters: dictionary JSON Dictionary. Returns: PTRMapConfig object.
docs.title: PTRUserInterfaceConfiguration

docs.text: PTRLocationSharingManagerInterface ¶ Inherits from NSObject Declared in PTRLocationSharingManagerInterface.h Overview ¶ Main manager class responsible for location upload and sharing. Instance Methods ¶ addListener: ¶ Adds listener to start receiving callbacks - ( void ) addListener: ( id < PTRLocationSharingManagerDelegate > ) * listenerToAdd * getAssetLocationsForAssetId:isGroup:forMaxAge:withCallback: ¶ Get the location(s) of a trackable asset or asset group. - ( void ) getAssetLocationsForAssetId: ( NSString * ) * assetIdentifier * isGroup :( BOOL ) * isGroup * forMaxAge :( long ) * maxAgeInSeconds * withCallback :( void ( ^ _Nonnull ) ( NSArray < PTROnlineLocation *> * _Nullable assetLocations )) * callback * Parameters: assetIdentifier the asset to get locations for. isGroup asset is Group or not. If isGroup is [YES] assetIdentifier must be an Asset Group Identifier. maxAgeInSeconds max age of asset locations to retrieve, if negative the configuration value is used (seconds,default is 1hour). callback callback called on response, arguments are the list of locations retrieved. getAssetsForMaxAge:WithCallback: ¶ Get list of trackable assets. - ( void ) getAssetsForMaxAge: ( long ) * maxAgeInSeconds * WithCallback :( void ( ^ _Nonnull ) ( NSArray < PTRIdentifierPair *> * _Nullable assets )) * callback * Parameters: maxAgeInSeconds the maximum age of the latest location of the available assets to retrieve. callback called on response, arguments are the list of asset identifiers retrieved. getLocationsWithPeerType:forMaxAge:withCallback: ¶ Get shared locations based on peerType. - ( void ) getLocationsWithPeerType: ( PTRLocationSharingPeerType ) * peerType * forMaxAge :( long ) * maxAgeInSeconds * withCallback :( void ( ^ _Nonnull ) ( NSArray < PTROnlineLocation *> * _Nullable locations )) * callback * Parameters: peerType the peerType. maxAgeInSeconds max age of locations to retrieve, if negative the configuration value. is used (seconds,default is 1hour). callback called on response, arguments are the list of locations retrieved. getSubscribersWithCallback: ¶ Get list of subscribers - ( void ) getSubscribersWithCallback: ( void ( ^ _Nonnull ) ( NSArray < PTRLocationSharingSubscriberData *> * _Nullable subscribers )) * callback * Parameters: callback called on response, arguments are the list of subscriber data removeListener: ¶ Removes listener to stop receiving callbacks - ( void ) removeListener: ( id < PTRLocationSharingManagerDelegate > ) * listenerToRemove * setExternalUserId: ¶ Sets the external user id, used as the username in absence of alias in terms of location sharing. It is only needed to be called once per device. - ( void ) setExternalUserId: ( NSString * ) * externalUserId * Parameters: externalUserId the value to set the PointCloud external user id associated with the device id start ¶ Starts manager, setting up all necessary subscriptions - ( void ) start startSharingSessionWithAlias:withDuration:withNotificationType:withRecipients:withSharingDirection:withCallback: ¶ Method to start a Location Sharing session. Call this method when you want to create a Sharing session with a specific group of people. If you’re interested in having location sharing inside a geofence or will all users from a venue, you don’t have to call this method. Just simply subscribe to peer type “Geofence” or “All”. - ( void ) startSharingSessionWithAlias: ( NSString * ) * alias * withDuration :( long ) * duration * withNotificationType :( PTRLocationSharingNotificationType ) * notificationType * withRecipients :( NSArray < NSString *> * ) * recipients * withSharingDirection :( PTRLocationSharingDirection ) * sharingDirection * withCallback :( void ( ^ _Nonnull ) ( NSString * _Nullable token , BOOL success )) * callback * Parameters: alias user alias that receiving parties see. duration how long to share location for in seconds. notificationType PTRLocationSharingNotificationType ::{Manual, Email, SMS}, manual option will not send any notifications, the token needs to be shared manual with other parties. recipients list of emails/phonenumbers to share token with. sharingDirection Direction of the sharing. Use “share” if you want to only share you location. Use “Receive” if you want to only receive other’s location and not send yours. Use “ShareReceive” if you want to share a receive locations. callback called on response, arguments are token, success. stop ¶ Stops manager, tearing down all subscriptions - ( void ) stop stopSharingSessionWithToken: ¶ Stop a Location Sharing session. This will stop the Location Sharing session for you and all subscribers. - ( void ) stopSharingSessionWithToken: ( NSString * ) * token * Parameters: token : the token to stop sharing location on. subscribeToToken:withAlias:withPeerType: ¶ Subscribe to a Location Sharing session. - ( void ) subscribeToToken: ( NSString * ) * token * withAlias :( NSString * ) * alias * withPeerType :( PTRLocationSharingPeerType ) * peerType * Parameters: token Use a token if you want to subscribe to a particular session. If you use a token you should set the peerType parameter to type group. alias The alias that will identify you. Others will see this alias under username property. peerType PTRLocationSharingPeerType (Unknown,Group,Geofence,All). If you want to subscribe to type Geofence or All, you should pass the token parameter as nil. unsubscribeFromToken: ¶ Unsubscribe to a Location Sharing session. Depending on the sharing direction of the seesion, others will stop seeing you and you will stop seeing others. - ( void ) unsubscribeFromToken: ( NSString * ) * token * Parameters: token the token to stop listening to.

docs.text: Method to start a Location Sharing session. Call this method when you want to create a Sharing session with a specific group of people. If you’re interested in having location sharing inside a geofence or will all users from a venue, you don’t have to call this method. Just simply subscribe to peer type “Geofence” or “All”. - ( void ) startSharingSessionWithAlias: ( NSString * ) * alias * withDuration :( long ) * duration * withNotificationType :( PTRLocationSharingNotificationType ) * notificationType * withRecipients :( NSArray < NSString *> * ) * recipients * withSharingDirection :( PTRLocationSharingDirection ) * sharingDirection * withCallback :( void ( ^ _Nonnull ) ( NSString * _Nullable token , BOOL success )) * callback * Parameters: alias user alias that receiving parties see. duration how long to share location for in seconds. notificationType PTRLocationSharingNotificationType ::{Manual, Email, SMS}, manual option will not send any notifications, the token needs to be shared manual with other parties. recipients list of emails/phonenumbers to share token with. sharingDirection Direction of the sharing. Use “share” if you want to only share you location. Use “Receive” if you want to only receive other’s location and not send yours. Use “ShareReceive” if you want to share a receive locations. callback called on response, arguments are token, success.
docs.title: startSharingSessionWithAlias:withDuration:withNotificationType:withRecipients:withSharingDirection:withCallback:

docs.text: Stops manager, tearing down all subscriptions - ( void ) stop
docs.title: stop

docs.text: Stop a Location Sharing session. This will stop the Location Sharing session for you and all subscribers. - ( void ) stopSharingSessionWithToken: ( NSString * ) * token * Parameters: token : the token to stop sharing location on.
docs.title: stopSharingSessionWithToken:

docs.text: Subscribe to a Location Sharing session. - ( void ) subscribeToToken: ( NSString * ) * token * withAlias :( NSString * ) * alias * withPeerType :( PTRLocationSharingPeerType ) * peerType * Parameters: token Use a token if you want to subscribe to a particular session. If you use a token you should set the peerType parameter to type group. alias The alias that will identify you. Others will see this alias under username property. peerType PTRLocationSharingPeerType (Unknown,Group,Geofence,All). If you want to subscribe to type Geofence or All, you should pass the token parameter as nil.
docs.title: subscribeToToken:withAlias:withPeerType:

docs.text: Unsubscribe to a Location Sharing session. Depending on the sharing direction of the seesion, others will stop seeing you and you will stop seeing others. - ( void ) unsubscribeFromToken: ( NSString * ) * token * Parameters: token the token to stop listening to.
docs.title: unsubscribeFromToken:
